verses.roman:
rājāra jñāna,--rāja-vaidyera ha-ila maraṇa
āpane nāmiyā tabe karāila cetana

synonyms: rājāra jñāna—the King thought; rāja-vaidyera—of the royal physician; ha-ila maraṇa—there was death; āpane—personally; nāmiyā—getting down; tabe—thereupon; karāila cetana—brought him to consciousness.
translation: "The King, fearing that the royal physician was killed, personally descended and brought him to his consciousness.
